physical_appearance: This is a hard cover book that contains the eye witness accounts of the embassy's travels to the East Indies and China. The book is in relatively good condition with the spine looking sturdy.
sgcool_label_text: This book contains the account of the first embassy sent by the Dutch East India Company (VOC) from 1655 to 1657 to the Emperor of China, as chronicled by Johan Nieuhof. It is one of the earliest European accounts of Chinese culture, society, geography, botany and zoology, and includes a detailed description of the East Indies. The text, based on Nieuhof's eyewitness account, is supplemented with numerous illustrations.
context_1: Dutch East India Company's first embassy to China
title_text: Johan Nieuhoff's L'Ambassade de la Compagnie Orientale des Provinces Unies vers l’Empereur de la Chine L'Ambassade de la Compagnie Orientale des Provinces Unies vers l’Empereur de la Chine An Embassy from the East-India Company of the United Provinces, to the Grand Tartar Cham, Emperor of China
subject_terms_1: translations (documents)  geography botany zoology  illustrations (layout features)  maps (documents)  expeditions (journeys)
subject_terms_2: Nederlandsche Oost-Indische Compagnie  Chinese culture & civilization? East Indies  Chronicles Asia  Geography  Botany Zoology  Maps Expedition  Nieuhof, Johannes, 1618-1672
